body:
I see, @mrry. Anyway, could you please help me a bit with this part? Currently I have the following behavior: when I start and stop server iteratively it fails in ~0.1% cases. It hangs on reading from the queue after shutdown (on `Next()` method).

I've also found out that request enqueueing happens asynchronously and sometimes after shutdown (actually I see that `ENQUEUE_REQUEST` guarded my mutex, but as result of async writing message enqueued after it). Do you know how to fix it? Can we write the message synchronously?
